comments: This gives the fourth column of the Sheffer triangle A143494 (2-restricted Stirling2 numbers). See the e.g.f. given below, and comments on the general case under A193685. [From Wolfdieter Lang, Oct 08 2011]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (14,-71,154,-120)
formula: If we define f(m,j,x)=sum(binomial(m,k)*stirling2(k,j)*x^(m-k),k=j..m) then a(n-3)=(-1)^(n-1)*f(n,3,-5), (n>=3). [From _Milan Janjic_, Apr 26 2009]If we define f(m,j,x)=sum(binomial(m,k)*stirling2(k,j)*x^(m-k),k=j..m) then a(n-3)=f(n,3,2), (n>=3). [From _Milan Janjic_, Apr 26 2009]a(n) = 3^(n+3)/2 -2*4^(n+2)-2^(n+2)/3+5^(n+3)/6. - R. J. Mathar, Mar 22 2011O.g.f.: 1/((1-2*x)*(1-3*x)*(1-4*x)*(1-5*x)).E.g.f.: diff(exp(2*x)*((exp(x)-1)^3)/3!,x$3). See the Sheffer comment given above. [From Wolfdieter Lang, Oct 08 2011]
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[1/((1 - 2 x) (1 - 3 x) (1 - 4 x) (1 - 5 x)), {x, 0, 25}], x] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jun 20 2011 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
